docs.snippet: As communities along the Eastern seaboard from Cape May to Boston battened down last night against a possible repetition of the disastrous hurricane of 1938, the Weather Bureau reported that the tropical storm that has been moving north off the coast...
docs.lead_paragraph: As communities along the Eastern seaboard from Cape May to Boston battened down last night against a possible repetition of the disastrous hurricane of 1938, the Weather Bureau reported that the tropical storm that has been moving north off the coast for several days apparently was blowing itself harmlessly out to sea.
